avalancheActivity.comment: Few small slabs released in Hengill area W-aspect.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow that has been transported and is starting to settle. Few small slabs released in Hengill area W-aspect.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow that has been transported and is starting to settle. Windslabs and loose snow in tha area. Few small slabs released in Hengill area W-aspect. Weeklayers could exist where older snow is underneath or within windslabs/new snow. Snow should gain strength

travelAdvisory.comment: Warming on Monday and Tuesday has impacted the snow pack in the mountains in most parts of the coutnry. The weather resulted in evacuations and danger warnings in Seyðisfjörður where warming and precipitation intesity was very high. Temperatures went above freezing in higher elevations in the East fjords. In North Iceland large avalanches released during the warming but wind slabs may still be present in upper elevations where dry snow is present. People traveling in steep terrain are advised to practice conservative terrain choices.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming on Monday and Tuesday has impacted the snowpack in the mountains in most parts. Avalanches released in the East fjords as a result and an avalanche danger warning remains for the region.

weatherForecast.highlights: Austlæg átt og einhver él til fjalla. Milt í veðri. Lítil lægðarbóla gæti komið inn á fimmtudag-föstudags með snjókomu

avalancheActivity.comment: Many avlanches a week ago but no recent reports of avalanche activity.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has started to settle but fresh windslabs expected in westerlu aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable new snow came in -NE winds about a week ago and a few dry slabs fell. Snowpit from Seljalandsdalur showed layered windslab and a weekness at about 60 cm depth. Snow should gain strength.

travelAdvisory.comment: Warming on Monday and Tuesday has impacted the snow pack in the mountains in most parts of the coutnry. The weather resulted in evacuations and danger warnings in Seyðisfjörður where warming and precipitation intesity was very high. Temperatures went above freezing in higher elevations in the East fjords. In North Iceland large avalanches released during the warming but wind slabs may still be present in upper elevations where dry snow is present. weatherForecast.highlights: A-átt of einhver él til fjalla, milt í veðri og hiti nokkrar gráður á láglendi og um frostmark í hæstu fjöllum á spásvæðinu

avalancheActivity.comment: Large avalanches were recorded in Skíðadalur on January 2nd and likely released due to warming on 1st and 2nd of January. A size 2.5 avalanche was likely released by snowmobilers in Hólsdalur on Dec 30th. An avalanche was reported on S aspect in Ólafsfjörður Dec 31st. Another large avalanche, size 3.5 was released on SW facing aspect in Hestskarðshnjúkur on Dec 30th as well as a few smaller ones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is present in all elevations and most aspects. The snow is light and drifted into soft slabs on W and N aspects in SE-directions on the 31st of December. Warming on January 1st impacted the snow pack up to 5-600 m and wind slabs as well as a persistent weakness can be expected above in higher elevations.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Since Christmas, a significant amount of new snow has been added in all elevations. Wind slabs have formed since in most aspects, but mostly in S and W aspects after strong south- to easterly winds. Cold temperatures in the last days of the year may have stimulated the growth of facets in the snow pack. Subsequent warming in the beginning of the year up to 5-600 m has impacted and likely strengthened the snow pack and decreased temperature gradient. Colder temperatures in the next days may encourage facet growth and higher temperature gradient.

travelAdvisory.comment: Warming on Monday and Tuesday has impacted the snow pack in the mountains in most parts of the coutnry. The weather resulted in evacuations and danger warnings in Seyðisfjörður where warming and precipitation intesity was very high. Temperatures went above freezing in higher elevations in the East fjords. In North Iceland large avalanches released during the warming but wind slabs may still be present in upper elevations where dry snow is present. People traveling in steep terrain are advised to practice conservative terrain choices.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Warming on Monday and Tuesday has impacted the snowpack in the mountains in most parts. Avalanches released in the East fjords as a result and an avalanche danger warning remains for the region.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætisveður og úrkomulítið á svæðinu næstu daga. Með vikunni kólnar smám saman.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wet avalanche in Skágil and a few wet sluffs. Wet slabs in many places size 1-2 but a few size 3.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of new snow in the mountains but rain in lower elevations. Snowfall in easterly winds and cooling later in the week.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Considerable amount of new snow came during NE-E winds. Wet snow at lower elevations but dry above aprox. 400 m elevation. Old firn/crust after melt/freeze cycle in some places under the new snow. Snowpit from Oddsskarð showed some facets below the crust.

travelAdvisory.comment: Warming on Monday and Tuesday has impacted the snow pack in the mountains in most parts of the coutnry. weatherForecast.highlights: Spáð er A-snjókomu til fjalla en rigningu neðan til. Minnkandi úrkoma á þriðjudag og miðvikudag. Fremur milt en kólnar svo aftur á miðvikudag og fimmtudag.
